gitlet

Class Repo

  • java.lang.Object
    • gitlet.Repo

  • public class Repo
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to hold a bunch of helper methods that allow our Gitlet object to function nicely

    • Method Detail

      • addHelper

        public static void addHelper(java.lang.String[] args,
                             Gitlet g)
        Stages files for commit. Checks to see if file exists. If so, checks to see if the current version is different from the last staged version and the last committed version (if applicable). If the files differ, the current version is serialised and saved in the .gitlet/staged directory under its normal file name. A mapping is created in g.stagingArea between the file name and the SHA1 value of the file contents. If a previous copy existed in .gitlet/staged, it is deleted and the old mapping is overwritten. Exits with System code 0 if the file doesn't exist, also reports "File does not exist" before exiting.
        Parameters:
        g - the current Gitlet object
        args - passed in args to program

      • branchHelper

        public static void branchHelper(java.lang.String[] args,
                                Gitlet g)
        Checks to see if the branch being passed in is valid. If valid, the function adds the branch to the HashMap of branches belonging to the current Gitlet object. The new branch is associated with the current commit (the commit at the HEAD branch). The new branch is not switched to during this instruction. Exits with System code 0 if an invalid branch name is given.
        Parameters:
        args - arguments passed in to Main.gitlet
        g - the current Gitlet object

      • checkOperands

        public static void checkOperands(java.lang.String[] args,
                                 int i)
        Validates the number of operands Exits with code 0 after printing error message if incorrect number of args are given. Ensures the commit arguments do not contain empty strings (Exits with System code 0 if so).
        Parameters:
        args - arguments passed in to Main.gitlet
        i - the (expected) correct number of operands

      • checkoutBranchHelper

        public static void checkoutBranchHelper(java.lang.String[] args,
                                        Gitlet g)
        First, checks to see if the given branch exits. If the branch is valid (see below for exit conditions), switches to the specified branch. Takes all files in the commit at the head of the given branch, and puts them in the working directory, overwriting the versions of the files that are already there if they exist. Any files that are tracked in the current branch but are not present in the checked-out branch are deleted. The staging area is cleared. Exits with System code 0 if the branch doesn't exist, if the branch is the current branch, or if there are untracked files waiting to be addressed.
        Parameters:
        args - arguments passed in to Main.gitlet
        g - the current Gitlet object

      • checkoutDashHelper

        public static void checkoutDashHelper(java.lang.String[] args,
                                      Gitlet g)
        Takes the version of the file as it exists in the head commit, the front of the current branch, and puts it in the working directory, overwriting the version of the file that's already there if there is one. The new version of the file is not staged. Exits with System code 0 if the file does not exist.
        Parameters:
        args - arguments passed in to Main.gitlet
        g - the current Gitlet object

      • checkoutIDNameHelper

        public static void checkoutIDNameHelper(java.lang.String[] args,
                                        Gitlet g)
        Takes the version of the file as it exists in the commit with the given id, and puts it in the working directory, overwriting the version of the file that's already there if there is one. The new version of the file is not staged. Exits with System code 0 if no Commit exists or if the file does not exist.
        Parameters:
        args - arguments passed in to Main.gitlet
        g - the current Gitlet object

      • commitHelper

        public static void commitHelper(java.lang.String[] args,
                                Gitlet g)
        First, checks to see if there are changes staged for commit. If changes are staged, obtains the most recent commit from the HEAD branch and creates a Commit which is its child. The function then creates mappings within this Commit's blobs from the names of the staged files to their ID's. A new directory is generated in .gitlet/commits/ where the serialised files previously residing in .gitlet/staged/ are now stored. This function then restores the staging area of the current Gitlet object to a new, initalised (but empty) HashMap. Exits with System code 0 in the case that there are no staged changes or if the delete function fails and files are unable to be removed from the staging area.
        Parameters:
        g - the current Gitlet object.
        args - passed in program args

      • deserialiseGitlet

        public static Gitlet deserialiseGitlet()
        Accesses the gitlet object stored in the .gitlet/gitlet.ser file and deserialises it, returning the original object Exits with system code 0 in case of IOException, does not exit otherwise. (SHOULD NOT EXIT, otherwise; this function allows other instructions to continue to modify the same Gitlet object!)
        Returns:
        the gitlet object from .gitlet

      • findHelper

        public static void findHelper(java.lang.String[] args,
                              Gitlet g)
        Searches through all Commits associated with the current Gitlet object. If a Commit is found whose message matches the message given, the ID is printed. Exits with System code 0 in the event that no Commits with matching messages are located.
        Parameters:
        args - arguments passed in to Main.gitlet
        g - the current Gitlet object

      • globalLogHelper

        public static void globalLogHelper(java.lang.String[] args,
                                   Gitlet g)
        Iterates through the list of all Commits associated with the given Gitlet object and prints them out in the same form as the regular log function (see format above). Does not exit in any case.
        Parameters:
        args - arguments passed in to Main.gitlet
        g - the Gitlet object from which to read the Commits

      • logHelper

        public static void logHelper(java.lang.String[] args,
                             Commit a)
        Prints all commits from HEAD to Initial Commit with the following format: === Commit Does not exit in any case.

      • mergeHelper

        public static void mergeHelper(java.lang.String[] args,
                               Gitlet g)
        Merges files from the given branch into the current branch. First, checks that the given branch is valid and not the current branch. Then, finds common ancestor of branches. - Any files that have been modified in the given branch, but not the current branch, are staged. - Files modified in the current branch but not in the given branch do not change. - Any files that were not present at the split point and are present only in the current branch should remain as they are. - Any files that were not present at the split point and are present only in the given branch should be checked out and staged. - Any files present at the split point, unmodified in the current branch branch, and absent in the given branch should be removed (and untracked). - Any files present at the split point, unmodified in the given branch, and absent in the current branch should remain absent. - Files in conflict are marked with "HEAD", "" notation and are not immediately staged If no conflicts are present, a Commit is generated with the message `Merged [current branch name] with [given branch name].' Otherwise the user is notified of conflict. Exits with System code 0 if there staged changes, invalid branches, or if there are untracked files.
        Parameters:
        args - arguments passed in to Main.gitlet
        g - the current Gitlet object

      • removeBranchHelper

        public static void removeBranchHelper(java.lang.String[] args,
                                      Gitlet g)
        Checks to see if branch given exits. If so, deletes branch from the mapping of branches in the current Gitlet object. Only removes branch pointer, does not delete any commits. Exits with System code 0 in the case that no such branch exists or if the branch name matches the current branch.
        Parameters:
        args - arguments passed in to Main.gitlet
        g - the current Gitlet object

      • removeHelper

        public static void removeHelper(java.lang.String[] args,
                                Gitlet g)
        If the file is a part of the current Commit, but the file is not in the staging area to be commited, the function removes the file from the working directory. Otherwise, if the file is in the staging area, the function removes the file from the staging area but does not modify the current working directory. Exits with System code 0: - "There is no reason to remove the file." The file is not staged or added - "Unable to remove file." working/staged Error with the delete function
        Parameters:
        g - the current Gitlet object
        args - arguments passed in to Main.gitlet

      • resetHelper

        public static void resetHelper(java.lang.String[] args,
                               Gitlet g)
        Takes all files in the specified Commit and resets them (checks them out) in the working directory. Sets the current branch head to be this Commit and clears the staging area. NOTE: THE COMMIT ID MAY BE ABBREVIATED Exits with System code 0 if no matching commit is found or if there are untracked files in the way of the reset.
        Parameters:
        args - arguments passed in to Main.gitlet
        g - the current Gitlet object

      • serialiseGitlet

        public static void serialiseGitlet(Gitlet t)
        Takes the current Gitlet object t and writes it (serialises it) to .gitlet/gitlet.ser Exits with code 0 both in case of error and after finishing serialisation
        Parameters:
        t - the Gitlet object to serialise

      • statusHelper

        public static void statusHelper(java.lang.String[] args,
                                Gitlet g)
        Prints out all branches associated with the current Gitlet object under the "=== Branches ===" heading. Branches are followed by staged files, removed files, modified (but not staged) files, and, finally, untracked files. If no files match the heading, the heading still prints but the body is blank (just the newline character). Does not exit in any case.
        Parameters:
        g - the current Gitlet object
        args - passed in args to program
